titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Rita Ricardo-Campbell Papers, 1964-1980
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and printed matter, relating to the administration and financing of higher education, the Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education, the Mountain States Regional Medical Program, and the National Center for Higher Education Management Systems

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Rita Ricardo-Campbell Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1978.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biography/Adminstrative History
bioghist.p: An american economist and educator as well as a senior fellow at the Hoover Institution, Ricardo-Campbell specialized in the health care sector and the economic and political problems of the Social Security system. She was for two years the Chairman of the Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education, for twelve years a director of the Gillette Company, for twenty-one years a director of the Watkins Johnson Company, and until recently a director of the Samaritan Medical Management Group. A native of Boston, Massachusetts, Ricardo-Campbell received a bachelor of science degree from Simmons College and master's and Ph.D. degrees from Harvard University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, and printed matter, relating to the administration and financing of higher education, the Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education, the Mountain States Regional Medical Program, and the National Center for Higher Education Management Systems

did.unittitle: Correspondence files, A-H, with detailed index in first folder

Annual reports, 1966-1974; This is WICHE, 1966-1976, 1976; The Inside, 1972-1976 March; WICHE calendar; Source book: com'ners, staff, program, etc.; Reports on Higher Education; Impact reports, 1968-1972
Higher education; booklets on correctional institutions; rehabilitation manpower; social work education; post-secondary education
Medical, including: mental health, nursing, psychiatrists-teachers; drug addiction; veterinarians, etc.
NCHEMS (National Center for Higher Education Management Systems at WICHE)
Higher Education and National Affairs, American Council on Education, 1970-75

Books, reports, other printed matter relating to financing and administering higher education. Reports, 1970-73. Ford Foundation Program for research in University Administration; Office of the Vice President - Planning, University of California
Invitations by the Committee for the American Bicentennial Presidential Inauguration to the inauguration of George Bush and Dan Quayle on January 20, 1989
WICHE (Western Interstate Commission for Higher Education), 1978-80
Conference on Inflation Agenda and notes, Washington D.C,
Resisting Hostile Takeovers: The Case of Gillette files,
Resisting Hostile Takeovers: The Case of Gillette files,
